intro: Diplusodon praetermissus, commonly known as the New Zealand mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of native trees such as pines and kānuka. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds. The plant is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and thrives in well-lit, open areas. It plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and sustenance for various wildlife species. However, its populations are threatened by habitat loss and environmental changes.
